A false<S>4820</S> balance<S>3976</S> is abomination<S>8441</S> to the LORD<S>3068</S>: but a just<S>8003</S> weight<S>68</S> is his delight<S>7522</S>. <sup>A false: Heb. Balances of deceit</sup> <sup>just: Heb. perfect stone</sup>
When pride<S>2087</S> cometh<S>935</S>, then cometh<S>935</S> shame<S>7036</S>: but with the lowly<S>6800</S> is wisdom<S>2451</S>.
The integrity<S>8538</S> of the upright<S>3477</S> shall guide<S>5148</S> them: but the perverseness<S>5558</S> of transgressors<S>898</S> shall destroy<S>7703</S> <S>7703</S> them.
Riches<S>1952</S> profit<S>3276</S> not in the day<S>3117</S> of wrath<S>5678</S>: but righteousness<S>6666</S> delivereth<S>5337</S> from death<S>4194</S>.
The righteousness<S>6666</S> of the perfect<S>8549</S> shall direct<S>3474</S> his way<S>1870</S>: but the wicked<S>7563</S> shall fall<S>5307</S> by his own wickedness<S>7564</S>. <sup>direct: Heb. rectify</sup>
The righteousness<S>6666</S> of the upright<S>3477</S> shall deliver<S>5337</S> them: but transgressors<S>898</S> shall be taken<S>3920</S> in their own naughtiness<S>1942</S>.
When a wicked<S>7563</S> man<S>120</S> dieth<S>4194</S>, his expectation<S>8615</S> shall perish<S>6</S>: and the hope<S>8431</S> of unjust<S>205</S> men perisheth<S>6</S>.
The righteous<S>6662</S> is delivered out<S>2502</S> of trouble<S>6869</S>, and the wicked<S>7563</S> cometh<S>935</S> in his stead.
An hypocrite<S>2611</S> with his mouth<S>6310</S> destroyeth<S>7843</S> his neighbour<S>7453</S>: but through knowledge<S>1847</S> shall the just<S>6662</S> be delivered<S>2502</S>.
When it goeth well<S>2898</S> with the righteous<S>6662</S>, the city<S>7151</S> rejoiceth<S>5970</S>: and when the wicked<S>7563</S> perish<S>6</S>, there is shouting<S>7440</S>.
By the blessing<S>1293</S> of the upright<S>3477</S> the city<S>7176</S> is exalted<S>7311</S>: but it is overthrown<S>2040</S> by the mouth<S>6310</S> of the wicked<S>7563</S>.
He that is void<S>2638</S> of wisdom<S>3820</S> despiseth<S>936</S> his neighbour<S>7453</S>: but a man<S>376</S> of understanding<S>8394</S> holdeth his peace<S>2790</S>. <sup>void: Heb. destitute of heart</sup>
A talebearer<S>1980</S> <S>7400</S> revealeth<S>1540</S> secrets<S>5475</S>: but he that is of a faithful<S>539</S> spirit<S>7307</S> concealeth<S>3680</S> the matter<S>1697</S>. <sup>A talebearer: Heb. He that walketh, being a talebearer</sup>
Where no counsel<S>8458</S> is, the people<S>5971</S> fall<S>5307</S>: but in the multitude<S>7230</S> of counsellors<S>3289</S> there is safety<S>8668</S>.
He that is surety<S>6148</S> for a stranger<S>2114</S> shall smart<S>7321</S> <S>7451</S> for it: and he that hateth<S>8130</S> suretiship<S>8628</S> is sure<S>982</S>. <sup>smart: Heb. be sore broken</sup> <sup>suretiship: Heb. those that strike hands</sup>
A gracious<S>2580</S> woman<S>802</S> retaineth<S>8551</S> honour<S>3519</S>: and strong<S>6184</S> men retain<S>8551</S> riches<S>6239</S>.
The merciful<S>2617</S> man<S>376</S> doeth good<S>1580</S> to his own soul<S>5315</S>: but he that is cruel<S>394</S> troubleth<S>5916</S> his own flesh<S>7607</S>.
The wicked<S>7563</S> worketh<S>6213</S> a deceitful<S>8267</S> work<S>6468</S>: but to him that soweth<S>2232</S> righteousness<S>6666</S> shall be a sure<S>571</S> reward<S>7938</S>.
As righteousness<S>6666</S> tendeth to life<S>2416</S>: so he that pursueth<S>7291</S> evil<S>7451</S> pursueth it to his own death<S>4194</S>.
They that are of a froward<S>6141</S> heart<S>3820</S> are abomination<S>8441</S> to the LORD<S>3068</S>: but such as are upright<S>8549</S> in their way<S>1870</S> are his delight<S>7522</S>.
Though hand<S>3027</S> join in hand<S>3027</S>, the wicked<S>7451</S> shall not be unpunished<S>5352</S>: but the seed<S>2233</S> of the righteous<S>6662</S> shall be delivered<S>4422</S>.
As a jewel<S>5141</S> of gold<S>2091</S> in a swine's<S>2386</S> snout<S>639</S>, so is a fair<S>3303</S> woman<S>802</S> which is without<S>5493</S> discretion<S>2940</S>. <sup>is without: Heb. departeth from</sup>
The desire<S>8378</S> of the righteous<S>6662</S> is only good<S>2896</S>: but the expectation<S>8615</S> of the wicked<S>7563</S> is wrath<S>5678</S>.
There is<S>3426</S> that scattereth<S>6340</S>, and yet increaseth<S>3254</S>; and there is that withholdeth<S>2820</S> more than is meet<S>3476</S>, but it tendeth to poverty<S>4270</S>.
The liberal<S>1293</S> soul<S>5315</S> shall be made fat<S>1878</S>: and he that watereth<S>7301</S> shall be watered<S>3384</S> also himself. <sup>liberal: Heb. soul of blessing</sup>
He that withholdeth<S>4513</S> corn<S>1250</S>, the people<S>3816</S> shall curse<S>5344</S> him: but blessing<S>1293</S> shall be upon the head<S>7218</S> of him that selleth<S>7666</S> it.
He that diligently seeketh<S>7836</S> good<S>2896</S> procureth<S>1245</S> favour<S>7522</S>: but he that seeketh<S>1875</S> mischief<S>7451</S>, it shall come<S>935</S> unto him.
He that trusteth<S>982</S> in his riches<S>6239</S> shall fall<S>5307</S>: but the righteous<S>6662</S> shall flourish<S>6524</S> as a branch<S>5929</S>.
He that troubleth<S>5916</S> his own house<S>1004</S> shall inherit<S>5157</S> the wind<S>7307</S>: and the fool<S>191</S> shall be servant<S>5650</S> to the wise<S>2450</S> of heart<S>3820</S>.
The fruit<S>6529</S> of the righteous<S>6662</S> is a tree<S>6086</S> of life<S>2416</S>; and he that winneth<S>3947</S> souls<S>5315</S> is wise<S>2450</S>. <sup>winneth: Heb. taketh</sup>
Behold, the righteous<S>6662</S> shall be recompensed<S>7999</S> in the earth<S>776</S>: much more the wicked<S>7563</S> and the sinner<S>2398</S>.
